required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to collect high-quality shoulder and intracardiac bi-plane fluoroscopic images during two standard arm motions on patients implanted with a market released SelectSecure 3830 lead for the purposes of developing a fracture reliability model.

primary_outcome.measure: Collect high quality shoulder and intracardiac bi-plane fluoroscopic cine images of the SelectSecure 3830 pacing lead.
primary_outcome.description: Fluoroscopic cine images will be collected in conjunction with a specialized calibration object. When imaging data is processed and analyzed it will characterize the time-varying lead shape changes.

secondary_outcome.description: During fluoroscopy of the two standard arm motions, accelerometer-based motion data will be collected which will allow matching of arm position with lead shape based on the fluoroscopic images.

intervention.description: In vivo acquisition of biplane cine radiographic images of the market released Medtronic SelectSecure 3830 pacing lead

study_pop.textblock: Subjects of both genders, 18 years of age and older that are currently implanted with at least one SelectSecure 3830 lead, regardless of device type and who meet all inclusion and no exclusion criteria are eligible for the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are at least 18 years of age
- Patient has a pacing, ICD or CRT system incorporating at least one SelectSecure 3830 lead in the right atrium or right ventricle
- Patients able and willing to attend imaging session
- Patients able and willing to give informed consent
- Pacing capture threshold and pacing impedance of the lead are within normal range at the time of enrollment
- Patient must be able to accomplish arm flexion and adduction past 90 degrees
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who require a legally authorized representative to obtain consent
- Subjects with exclusion criteria required by local law (e.g. age, breastfeeding)
- Pregnant women, or women of child bearing potential and who are not on a reliable form of birth control
- Subjects that were implanted with a pacing, ICD, CRT device and/or cardiac leads less than three months ago
